identified-content.person: Smith, Dr. Sarah Bland (Dr. Sarah Bland Butterworth)

block.p: Dr. Sarah Bland Smith and James Frederick Butterworth were married in Boulder, Colo., yesterday afternoon. They married themselves under Colorado law. David Secunda and Carmela Weber, friends of the couple, led the ceremony at the Sunrise Amphitheater, an outdoor event space.

Dr. Smith, 39, is known as Sallie. She is a neurologist in Denver and a clinical instructor in neurology at the University of Colorado School of Medicine. She also has a hypnotherapy practice in Boulder. She graduated from the University of North Carolina and received a medical degree from Columbia.

Dr. Sarah Bland Smith and James Frederick Butterworth were married in Boulder, Colo., yesterday afternoon. They married themselves under Colorado law. David Secunda and Carmela Weber, friends of the couple, led the ceremony at the Sunrise Amphitheater, an outdoor event space.

Dr. Smith, 39, is known as Sallie. She is a neurologist in Denver and a clinical instructor in neurology at the University of Colorado School of Medicine. She also has a hypnotherapy practice in Boulder. She graduated from the University of North Carolina and received a medical degree from Columbia.
She is a daughter of Diana A. DeVere of Minneapolis and Robert Bland Smith Jr. of Washington and a stepdaughter of Niente I. Smith.

Mr. Butterworth, 45, is a producer and director of ''Seoul Train,'' a documentary film about North Korean refugees, which was shown on the PBS series ''Independent Lens'' and won a 2007 Alfred I. duPont-Columbia University award for broadcast journalism. He graduated from the Georgia Institute of Technology and received an M.B.A. from Dartmouth.
He is a son of Rubie P. Butterworth of Tallahassee, Fla., and the late Charles A. Butterworth Jr.
